intro: Eurychiton adensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fig-like fruits. Eurychiton adensis thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to the unique ecological conditions of Socotra.
